intro: Anthemis bornmuelleri var. brachyota, commonly known as the dwarf anthemis, is a low-growing perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to orange-yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental horticulture.
